intro: Nengella minor, commonly known as the dwarf nengella, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
